title: 114_s2125
content: The Act titled "Small Business Lending and Economic Inequality Reduction Act of 2015" includes a section on the Community Advantage Program. The Small Business Act is amended to include the Community Advantage Program, which defines covered institutions as development companies, nonprofit intermediaries, and certified community development financial institutions. The term 'Reservist' in the Community Advantage Program refers to a member of a reserve component of the Armed Forces. The term 'small business concern in an underserved market' refers to a small business located in a low- or moderate-income community, HUBZone, or designated empowerment zone with over 50% of employees residing in a low- or moderate-income community. The Community Advantage Program under subparagraph (B) provides loans to small business concerns meeting specific criteria, including being owned and controlled by veterans, service-disabled veterans, or members of the Armed Forces participating in the Transition Assistance Program. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans made by covered institutions, with a focus on small business concerns in underserved markets. At least 60 percent of loans made under the program must go to small businesses in underserved markets. The program consists of loans to small businesses in underserved markets, with a maximum loan amount of $350,000. The Administrator will promulgate regulations similar to the Community Advantage Pilot Program within a year of enactment. The Community Advantage Pilot Program of the Administration will not be carried out. Amendments to the Small Business Act exclude covered institutions from the definition of a business concern. The Community Advantage Pilot Program will not be implemented. Amendments to the Small Business Act exclude covered institutions from the definition of a business concern. The Federal Home Loan Bank Act is amended to include community development financial institutions in the purposes of advances and collateral available.
